title: Fix Upcycle and Recycle buttons with submission pop-ups

requirements.text: Create a pop-up dialog component that opens when clicking the Resale, Upcycle, or Recycle buttons in MaterialGradeDashboard, replacing the current external link behavior

quotes: when clicking this button(resale, upcycle, recycle) there should open a pop-up

acceptanceCriteria: Clicking Resale button opens submission dialog
Clicking Upcycle button opens submission dialog
Clicking Recycle button opens submission dialog
Dialog can be closed without submitting

requirements.text: Add form fields in the submission pop-up for: clothing/dress type (text input or dropdown), number of pieces (numeric input), and display calculated credits earned based on the category and quantity

quotes: we can submit which type of clothes /dress we are giving and no. of cloth pieces. no. of credits we earn

acceptanceCriteria: Form includes clothing type input field
Form includes number of pieces numeric input
Credits earned are calculated and displayed in the dialog
Different credit rates apply for Resale, Upcycle, and Recycle categories

requirements.text: Store clothing submissions in backend state with fields for submission type (resale/upcycle/recycle), clothing type, quantity, credits earned, and timestamp
acceptanceCriteria: Backend method accepts submission data with type, clothing description, quantity, and credits
Submissions are persisted in stable storage

requirements.text: Update GreenCreditWallet balance when submissions are successfully processed, adding the earned credits to the user's total
acceptanceCriteria: Submitting clothing increases credit balance in GreenCreditWallet
Balance update is reflected immediately in the UI
Recent activity in GreenCreditWallet shows the new submission

requirements.text: Maintain a simple, clean interface design consistent with the existing sage green and off-white color palette
acceptanceCriteria: Pop-up dialog uses existing color scheme from index.css
Form layout is clean and uncluttered

constraints: Do not change the existing MaterialGradeDashboard card layout or styling
Keep the current sage green and soft charcoal color palette defined in index.css
Maintain the simple, clean aesthetic of the existing design
nonGoals: Complex credit calculation formulas beyond basic quantity-based rates
Admin dashboard or submission review workflow
